results.title: The British avant-garde. 2. The Thirties: the official and unofficial avant-garde
results.brief_description: A compilation of British avant-garde and experimental documentary films from the thirties. The thirties in Britain was a period characterised by the slump, hunger marches and the rise of Fascism in Europe. These shifts led to a social idealism that is reflected in the ongoing flourishing of the avant-garde filmmaking that began in the twenties, and the founding of British realism under the auspices of the Empire Marketing Board and the GPO Film Unit. The diversity of filmmaking that characterises this era can be clearly seen in this compilation where different styles and genres jostle each other as do quite distinct voices, attitudes and political ideologies.

results.title: The British avant-garde. 1. The Twenties: Close up and The Film Society
results.brief_description: A compilation of rare British avant-garde and experimental films from the twenties. The loose group of filmmakers represented here contributed not only films, many of which are now lost or neglected, but also, by establishing the influential Film Society in 1925 and the equally influential film magazine ‘Close Up’ a few years later, provided a cultural framework for a complex web of film practices ranging from avant-garde experiments to agit-prop.
results.title_for_label: The British avant-garde. 1. The Twenties: Close up and The Film Society

results.title: The Bristol school
results.creator_credit: E.J. Perry and Victoria. Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description:
A look at the Victorian Department of Education’s work in importing 100 pressed aluminium building from Bristol, England. These buildings can be erected in 2 days and will provide accommodation of 8,000 students in an attempt to overcome overcrowding within Victorian schools.

The construction process is shown with one being assembled in the Melbourne University grounds near the Melbourne Teacher’s College.

The film print from which the digital copy was made was badly damaged and the digital version shows evidence of that.

results.title: The Bright young newcomer
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Office Supervisor’s Problem Series”.
One of a series of six films designed to help supervision and middle management improve human relations in the office. By failing to properly channel the initiative of the bright young newcomer, the supervisor is presented with an unpleasant ultimatum by his senior clerk. For the audience to discuss is the question as to what the supervisor could have done to avoid friction among the staff.

results.title: The Bright side
results.creator_credit: Affiliated Film Producers, Mental Health Board and Irving Jacoby
results.brief_description: Shows how parents day-to-day enjoyment of family living provides the best emotional climate for children. An excerpt from a longer film on mental illness, “The Lonely night”, depicts a mentally healthy family, the Dunns, the relaxed and sensible way in which the parents deal with minor problems and discords, and the personal satisfaction of each individual as they share in the responsibilities and pleasures of the family. Reaffirms the intuitive wisdom of parents who themselves have mature and healthy personalities.

results.title: The Bright land
results.creator_credit: Guy Glover, ONF | NFB and Morten Parker
results.brief_description: This tour of the islands in the West Indies Federation looks at the various resources of the islands, including sugar, coffee, bananas, oil, and bauxite. Good contrast between the beauty of the landscape and life on the land, with the moderninity of city life.

results.title: The Bridges of Madison County
results.creator_credit: Amblin Entertainment, Malpaso Company, Clint Eastwood and Kathleen Kennedy
results.brief_description: Robert Kincaid (Clint Eastwood) is a photographer for National Geographic on assignment shooting the old bridges of Madison County. He meets Francesca Johnson (Meryl Streep), a farm wife whose husband and children have gone away for a week and the two fall in love. Both realise that their love is special but that their lives can only touch for a few short days. Based on the best selling heart warming novel by Robert James Waller.

results.title: The Bridge on the River Kwai [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Sam Spiegel, Columbia, Horizon (US), Horizon (GB) and David Lean
results.brief_description: Hailed as the greatest war film and distinguished by a visual and narrative sweep rare in modern cinema, David Lean’s masterpiece combines a relentless battle of wills with unparalleled action and spectacle. Based on Pierre Boulle’s best seller and starring Alec Guinness, William Holden and Jack Hawkins, this is the gripping tale of British POWs, captured by the Japanese in World War II and ordered to build a bridge to accommodate the Burma-Siam Railway. Honoured with 7 Academy Awards including Best Picture, Best Actor (Alec Guinness) and Best Director, this film continues to be one of the most memorable cinematic experiences. The bridge demolition scene remains a brilliant piece of stunt photography.

results.title: The Bridge
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television and Jo Kennedy
results.brief_description: Danny Craven lives in Launching Place, a quiet town that is relatively isolated from the rest of the community. One day when Danny is buying groceries for her dysfunctional family, she watches the cars go by on the highway, wishing that one of them can transport her away. She meets Gary, a young man to whom she is instantly attracted and in one night discovers love and horror under the bridge.
